Description: Start of Libyan Civil War leading to significant disruption in oil production (Libya produces ~1.6M barrels/day)
Expected_Impact: Positive (price increase due to supply shock)

Description: Islamic State captures key oil infrastructure in northern Iraq creating supply uncertainty
Expected_Impact: Positive (price increase due to security concerns)

Description: OPEC decides not to cut production despite falling prices to maintain market share against US shale
UK votes to leave European Union causing global economic uncertainty and demand concerns
Expected_Impact: Negative (price decrease due to demand uncertainty)

Description: OPEC agrees to first production cut since 2008 (1.2M barrels/day) to support prices
Expected_Impact: Positive (price increase due to supply reduction)

Event: US Withdraws from Iran Nuclear Deal
Description: US reimmposes sanctions on Iranian oil exports removing ~2M barrels/day from market
Expected_Impact: Positive (price increase due to supply reduction)

Description: US grants temporary waivers to 8 countries to continue importing Iranian oil reducing supply impact
Expected_Impact: Negative (price decrease due to continued supply)

Description: US ends all waivers for Iranian oil importers aiming to bring Iran's exports to zero
Expected_Impact: Positive (price support due to supply tightness)

Description: Saudi Arabia and Russia fail to agree on production cuts; Saudi increases production and offers discounts
WHO declares COVID-19 pandemic; global lockdowns devastate oil demand
OPEC+ agrees to record 9.7M barrel/day production cut to stabilize collapsing prices
Severe winter storm disrupts US oil production and refining capacity
Russia's invasion of Ukraine triggers extensive Western sanctions on Russian oil exports
Expected_Impact: Positive (significant price spike due to supply fears)

Description: IEA announces largest-ever strategic reserve release (180M barrels) to cool prices
OPEC+ announces 2M barrel/day production cut despite Western pressure to increase supply
